channel.title: Graphics on Jörn Alexander Quent's notebook
channel.description: Recent content in Graphics on Jörn Alexander Quent's notebook

item.title: Various graphic settings in unity
item.description: Graphical setting used for stimulus presentation: Use Legacy Cinematic Image Effects. Player > Other Settings > Color space > linear. Quality > Anti-Aliasing > 8x Multi Sampling.

item.title: Lighting and 3D models
item.description: To create realistic light, set environment lighting to colour and use white. To find suitable 3D models for my virtual kitchen, I looked for models on https://archive3d.net.

item.title: HPC activity and graphics in Unity
item.description: Frankland et al. (2005) reviews that HPC ripple activity is temporally correlated with cortical slow-wave spindles in the MPFC. This could be related to the integration of memories into existing schema. Unity tutorial on graphics: If I want to spawn objects at random locations, it would be problematic to pre-compute the lighting. Would it be a solution to be used mixed baking and have all the items, which do not change their location, as static because they have light maps?
